gurmukhi: ਚਵੰ ਚਾਰ ਢੂਕੇ ॥ ਮੁਖੰ ਮਾਰ ਕੂਕੇ ॥
translation: Four types of forces rushed and shouted from their mouths: “Kill, Kill”.

gurmukhi: ਲੲੇ ਬਾਣ ਪਾਣੰ ॥ ਸੁ ਕਾਤੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣੰ ॥੧੪॥੫੨॥
transliteration: Lae Baan Paanan|| Su Kaantoo Kridaanan||14||52||
translation: They took up in their hands the arrows, daggers and swords.14.52.
They are all active in warfare and shoot arrows.
The weapons like swods and daggers glisten.15.53.
The great heroes rushed forward and many on them shot arrows.

transliteration: Darain Baar Dhaae|| Phire Jyon Gadgadroo||16||54||
translation: They strike blows on the enemy with much swiftness like the watter-bird.16.54.
With elevated tail and full of rage the lion ran forward.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤੇ ਸੰਖ ਲੈ ਹਾਥ ਦੇਵੀ ਬਜਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Ite Sankh Lai Haath Devoo Bajaayo||
translation: There the goddess holding the conch in her hand, blew it.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰੀ ਚੳੁਦਹੂੰ ਯੌ ਰਹਿਯੋ ਨਾਦ ਪੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Puroo Chaudahoon Yau Rahiyo Naad Pooran||
translation: Its sound reverberated in all the fourteen regions.

gurmukhi: ਚਮੱਕਿਓ ਮੁਖੰ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੇ ਮੱਧਿ ਨੂਰੰ ॥੧੭॥੫੫॥
translation: The face of the goddess was filled with brightness in the battlefield.17.55.
Then Dhumar Nain, the weapon-wielder, was greatly excited.

gurmukhi: ਲੲੇ ਸੰਗ ਜੋਧਾ ਬਡੇ ਬੀਰ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Lae San Jodhaa Bade Boor Bhdaroo||
translation: He took many brave warriors with him.

gurmukhi: ਲਯੋ ਬੇੜਿ ਪਬੰ ਕੀਯੋ ਨਾਦ ੳੁੱਚੰ ॥
transliteration: Layo Bed(i) Paban Kooyo Naad Ouchchannd||
translation: They besieged the mountain and began to shout at the top of their voice.
